meanings.sent1: The waddie rode his horse across the vast prairie.
meanings.sent2: The waddie rounded up the cattle at sunrise.
meanings.sent3: The waddie's hat flew off as he chased after the runaway calf.
meanings.sent4: The waddie was the guardian of the herd, like a vigilant sentinel.
meanings.sent5: The waddie's lasso skills were unmatched in the west.

meanings.definition: A short, heavy stick or club
meanings.sent1: He used a waddie to stir the campfire embers.
meanings.sent2: The old man leaned on his waddie as he walked along the trail.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended the waddie was a magic wand.
meanings.sent4: The waddie lay by the door, a silent protector of the homestead.
meanings.sent5: The waddie's weight gave it a sturdy feel in the hand.

meanings.definition: To walk with short steps, swaying from side to side
meanings.sent1: She waddied across the room in her oversized slippers.
meanings.sent2: The ducklings waddied behind their mother in a straight line.
meanings.sent3: The penguin waddied comically on the ice, entertaining the zoo visitors.
meanings.sent4: He waddied through the crowd, trying to keep up with his friends.
meanings.sent5: The toddler waddied confidently towards his waiting parents.
